thread.title: Ex-Peanut Executive Sentenced to 28 Years in Prison for Salmonella Coverup
thread.title_full: Ex-Peanut Executive Sentenced to 28 Years in Prison for Salmonella Coverup - WSJ

author: Jesse Newman
title: Ex-Peanut Executive Sentenced to 28 Years in Prison for Salmonella Coverup
text:
A former Georgia peanut executive was sentenced to 28 years in prison Monday for presiding over a coverup that led to a deadly salmonella outbreak, marking what legal experts believe to be the most severe punishment to date in a U.S. food-safety case.
A U.S. district judge in Albany, Ga., sentenced Stewart Parnell, the former owner of Peanut Corp. of America, after a jury found him guilty last year on dozens of felony counts, including conspiracy to conceal that many of the companyâ€™s products were contaminated with...
